pycallingcards.plotting.heatmap#

pycallingcards.plotting.heatmap(adata_ccf, rna=None, figsize=(28, 8), font_scale=1, cmap='BuPu', rnalabels=None, log=True, title='Relative calling cards and RNA information', save=False)[source]#

Plot ranking of peaks.

Parameters:

  • adata_ccf (AnnData) – Annotated data matrix.

  • ran – pd.DataFrame. pd.DataFrame for RNA data (genes*sample). Make sure the sample is in the same order of adata_ccf.obs

  • figsize (Tuple[int, int] (default: (28, 8))) – Default is (28, 8). The size of the figure.

  • font_scale (float (default: 1)) – Default is 1. The scale of the font size.

  • cmap (str (default: 'BuPu')) – Default is ‘BuPu’. Color map of the plot.

  • rnalabels (Optional[list] (default: None)) – Default is None. The labels of the rna data. Be sure the length of list match the number of sample in rna file.

  • log (bool (default: True)) – Default is True. Whether to log transform the gene expression or not.

  • title (str (default: 'Relative calling cards and RNA information')) – Default is ‘Relative calling cards and RNA information’. The title of the plot.

  • save (Union[bool, str] (default: False)) – Default is False. Could be bool or str indicating the file name it would be saved. If True, a default name would be given and the plot would be saved as png.
